title: How to change log level
content:
To change the log level on the UCMDB Gateway side, change the loglevel parameter in the UCMDB Gateway configuration.properties file.

Log files of the UCMDB Gateway can be found in the logs folder in the installation directory.

If you use Containerized UD/UCMDB

Edit the values.yaml file used to install UD/UCMDB and add the cmsgateway.deployment.node.loglevel paramerer as below.

On a control plane node, run the following command to apply the change to the UCMDB Gateway service. This will restart the UCMDB Gateway.

helm upgrade <UD/UCMDB RELEASE NAME> <UD/UCMDB CHART FILE> --namespace <NAMESPACE> -f <VALUES YAML FILE>

Where,

  • <UD/UCMDB RELEASE NAME> is the release name of the UD/UCMDB deployment.
  • <UD/UCMDB CHART FILE> is the tar file containing the UD/UCMDB installation charts.
  • <NAMESPACE> is the namespace of the UD/UCMDB deployment.
  • <VALUES YAML FILE> is your custom values.yaml file used to install UD/UCMDB.

For example:

helm upgrade ucmdb-prod ucmdb-helm-charts/charts/cms-2020.08.xxx.tgz --namespace ucmdb-prod -f my-values.yaml
